item.title: Armed gang steals toilet paper in panic-buying Hong Kong...
item.description:
www.yahoo.com
A gang of knife-wielding men jumped a delivery driver in Hong Kong and stole hundreds of toilet rolls, police said Monday, in a city wracked by shortages caused by coronavirus panic-buying. Toilet rolls have become hot property in the densely packed business hub, despite government assurances that supplies

item.title: DAVID IGNATIUS
item.description:
www.washingtonpost.com
David Ignatius writes a twice-a-week foreign affairs column.

item.title: Corporations working with Trump administration to control online speech...
item.description:
www.washingtonpost.com
Whenever laws are passed to put the government in control of speech, the people who get hurt are the least powerful in society.

item.title: Federal judges' association calls emergency meeting after DOJ intervenes in cases...
item.description:
www.usatoday.com
An association of federal judges has called an emergency meeting after Attorney General William Barr intervened in the case of Trump ally Roger Stone.

item.title: New Ad Takes on Bernie Bros: 'Really?'
item.description:
www.thewrap.com
Billionaire Michael Bloomberg's new campaign spot focuses on online behavior of some of Sen. Bernie Sanders' most ardent supporters
